update.description:
Two new tools added to the gui

**Align**

1. in Arrow mode,  select a model with the mouse

2. Ctrl + Left Click to select more models (the last one selected will be used as the basis of alignment)

3. Click on the align icon and choose an align configuration

**Snap**

1. Click on the snap icon

2. Click on a face of a model to select a triangle on its mesh

3. Click on a face of another model to snap the first model to it.

Sorry for the long pull request
update.title: GUI Align and Snap tools

content.raw:
The alignment says has labels X, Y, and Z, but there's no indication for what those directions mean in the 3D rendered gazebo scene. I have to just click one to see which direction it is.

As a developer, I know that I can hold x, y, or z while panning to move the camera along those axes, but without that knowledge, it's not immediately discoverable.
content.html:
The alignment says has labels X, Y, and Z, but there's no indication for what those directions mean in the 3D rendered gazebo scene. I have to just click one to see which direction it is.

As a developer, I know that I can hold x, y, or z while panning to move the camera along those axes, but without that knowledge, it's not immediately discoverable.

content.raw:
I agree, the first object selected should be the "base".

You could add a drop-down in the align tool that lets you specify what the movement will be relative too. See inkscape for an example.
content.html:
I agree, the first object selected should be the "base".

You could add a drop-down in the align tool that lets you specify what the movement will be relative too. See inkscape for an example.

content.raw:
1. Can you make the align tool disabled until two objects have been selected?

content.html:
1. Can you make the align tool disabled until two objects have been selected?

  2. Add a tool-tip to the align tool that says something like "Select 2 objects to align"

  3. Highlight the triangle under the cursor when in snap mode.

content.raw:
When I align multiple models, it uses the last item that I select as the base, as you say in the description of this pull request. This feels backwards to me. I would expect the first thing I select to be the base. It could go either way, but it isn't clear which is actually the base. Should there be a different highlighting color for the one that will be used as the base for alignment?

Or maybe show a ghost image of what the alignment would look like as the mouse cursor hovers over each alignment option?
content.html:
When I align multiple models, it uses the last item that I select as the base, as you say in the description of this pull request. This feels backwards to me. I would expect the first thing I select to be the base. It could go either way, but it isn't clear which is actually the base. Should there be a different highlighting color for the one that will be used as the base for alignment?

Or maybe show a ghost image of what the alignment would look like as the mouse cursor hovers over each alignment option?

content.raw: I see the align icons even when I don't have multiple things selected. Should they icons be disabled if I can't click on them?
content.html: I see the align icons even when I don't have multiple things selected. Should they icons be disabled if I can't click on them?
